page.title: 04ADIT MINING AROUND ST.AGNES
page.content: DUE TO THE GROUND BEING ONCE RICH IN TIN ORE THE AREA ALONG THE COASTLINE IS RIDDLED WITH DISUSED ADITS.ADITS ARE MINING TUNNELS WHICH START AT THE BASE OF THE CLIFF GOING SLIGHTLY UPWARDS SO THAT THEY WILL NOT FLOOD.AN ADIT IS EASIER TO MINE THAN A TUNNEL INLAND BECAUSE NO MACHINERY IS NEEDED TO DRAIN OUT WATER AND LIFT ROCK AND MEN UP AND DOWN THE SHAFT.ONE TUNNEL DIVIDES INTO OTHER TUNNELS LEADING OFF IN ALL DIRECTIONS SO IT IS VERY EASY TO GET LOST.IN THE WALLS THERE ARE LOTS OF MINERALS. THESE ADITS ARE IN PLACES SUPPORTED BY TIMBERS.ADITS ARE VERY DANGEROUS PLACES LANDSLIDES OFTEN BLOCK THEM UP AND IF THE TIMBERS SNAP THE ROOF MAY CAVE IN BLOCKING THE TUNNEL.
